name: Unintentional Humorous Quotes and Advertisements! Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which former American President said, "Now we are trying to get unemployment to go up, and I think we're going to succeed"?
questions.explanation:
Ronald Reagan.

	Jack Warner was quoted as saying, about Ronald Reagan, "It's our fault, we should have given him better parts" when he heard that'Ronnie' had been elected governor of California and Ronald Reagan himself said, in 1973, "The thought of being President frightens me and I do not think I want the job!" ~Ronald Reagan in 1973

questions.text: Which American Vice-Presidential hopeful said, "I believe we are on an irreversible trend toward more freedom and democracy.  But that could change"?
questions.explanation:
Dan Quayle.

	In 1989, Dan Quayle, then Vice President said, "I stand by all the misstatements that I've made!"

questions.text: Which American said, "They x-rayed my head and found nothing"?
questions.explanation:
Jerome Dean.

	In 1941, Jerome 'Dizzy' Dean became a commentator on radio and television after an injury ended his pitching career.  In 1952, he was honoured by being elected to the National Baseball Hall of Fame.

questions.text: In which country did the following advertisement appear?  "Pepsi brings your ancestors back from the grave"?
questions.explanation:
China.

	Coca-Cola's first advertisement in China, which translated into "Bite the wax tadpole" was nearly as bad, and Electrolux, the Scandinavian vacuum cleaner maker, used the following advertisement in the US, "Nothing sucks like an Electrolux."

questions.text: Which former American President, thinking he was 'off-air' at the time said, "My fellow Americans, I've signed legislation that will outlaw Russia forever. We begin bombing in five minutes"?
questions.explanation:
Ronald Reagan.

	The United States is not the only country to have an ex-actor as a presidential hopeful and then President. Another such country that springs to mind is the Philippines!

questions.text: American president Richard Nixon said, "This is a great day for France" on what occasion?
questions.correct: The funeral of Charles de Gaulle
options: The inauguration of Charles de Gaulle
The official opening of the Eiffel Tower
The freeing of  France at the end of WWII
questions.explanation:
The funeral of Charles de Gaulle.

	"Now, like, I'm President", another quote from the 37th President of the US, Richard Nixon, who also said, "I am not a crook ..." and, "When the President does it, that means that it is not illegal."

questions.text: The bare necessities of life, according to whom, were "Food, clothing, and a blonde"?
questions.explanation:
W. C. Fields

	Also remembered for stating, that, "There may be some things better than sex and some things may be worse, but there is nothing exactly like it", and, "Children should neither be seen nor heard from - ever again."

questions.text: "Bigamy is having one wife too many.  Monogamy is the same" was said by whom?
questions.explanation:
Oscar Wilde.

	One of, probably, the most misunderstood great British dramatists, authors. and poets.  He was born in Ireland in 1854, and died at the relatively tender age of 46!  He was also quoted as saying, "Women's styles may change, but their designs remain the same."

questions.text: Which American author said, "Most writers regard truth as their most valuable possession and therefore are most economical in its use"?
questions.explanation:
Mark Twain.

	Mark Twain was also quoted as saying, "Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it" and "There is no end to the laws, and no beginning to the execution of them."

questions.text: Which American comedian said, "Sex is the most fun I have ever had - without laughing"?
questions.explanation:
Woody Allen.

	Actor, comedian, director, and writer, Woody Allen is renowned for his 'black' sense of humour.  He is also quoted as saying, "You can live to be a hundred if you give up all the things that make you want to live to be a hundred!"
